clinical_study.brief_title: Measurement of Psychomotor Recovery After Anesthesia Using 4CRT
clinical_study.official_title: Measurement of Psychomotor Function Recovery in Patients After General Anesthesia Using 4-Choice Reaction Time Test

collaborator.agency: Department of Anesthesiology, Hospital Dresden-Friedrichstadt, Dresden, Germany

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the investigation is to validate the SmartPhone-based 4-Reaction Choice Time Test (4CRT) as a measure for recovery of the psychomotor function in patients after general anesthesia. One hundred female patients, scheduled to ambulatory gynecological surgery in general anesthesia, will be randomized to the group with pharmacological anxiolytic premedication with midazolam (N=50) and to the group without midazolam (N=50). All patients will be monitored using 4CRT before and after standardized general anesthesia. The reaction time, measured with 4CRT is the primary outcome parameter of the investigation.

detailed_description.textblock: 4CRT is a classical psychological test, used to measure the psychomotor speed. This test measures choice reaction time. The participants are instructed to respond by pressing the keys 1-4 of the keyboard, corresponding to the numbers, appearing on the screen of computer (PDA, SmartPhone). The average of the response latency, measured during the 10 trials is usually taken as 4CRT outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of four choice reaction time from baseline
primary_outcome.time_frame: One time before the surgery and 2 hours after the surgery
primary_outcome.description: One time immediately before the surgery and 6 times within 2 hours after the surgery for each participant

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 2 hours after the surgery only in 40 (20 from each group) participants

arm_group.description: Participant who will not receive midazolam for pharmacological anxiolytic premedication before general surgery
Participant who will receive midazolam for pharmacological anxiolytic premedication before general surgery

intervention.description: The participants receive the pharmacological premedication before the surgery anyway

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Physical status I-III according to American Society of Anesthesiology
- ambulatory gynecologic surgery of 10-40 min
- patient is able to use VAS and to use SmartPhone-based 4CRT
- given informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- age < 18 or > 50 years
- patients who are not able to give their informed consent
- surgery lasts more than 40 min.
- history of psychopharmaceuticals or analgesics
